Welcome to Towerpy's documentation!
-----------------------------------

**Towerpy** is an open-source toolbox for processing polarimetric weather radar data.

Check out the :ref:`installation` section for further information about how to install Towerpy.

.. note::

   This project is under development.

Citing
------
If you find towerpy useful for a scientific publication, please consider citing the Towerpy `paper <https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S1364815223001329>`_:

.. code-block::
   :caption: BibTeX

       @article{sanchezrivas2023, title = {{Towerpy: An open-source toolbox for processing polarimetric weather radar data}},
       journal = {Environmental Modelling & Software}, pages= {105746}, year = {2023}, issn = {1364-8152},
       doi = {https://doi.org/10.1016/j.envsoft.2023.105746}, author = {Daniel Sanchez-Rivas and Miguel Angel Rico-Ramirez},
       keywords = {Weather radar, Polarimetry, Radar QPE, Radar research applications, Open source}}

Contributing
------------
Thank you for investing your time in contributing to our project!

Feel free to post a message to our `discussions page <https://github.com/uobwatergroup/towerpy/discussions>`_ or have a look at our `contribution guidelines <https://github.com/uobwatergroup/towerpy/blob/main/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md>`_ to find out about our coding standards.

Team
----
Towerpy is created and maintained by
`Daniel Sanchez-Rivas <https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=NQSB5-8AAAAJ&hl=en>`_
and
`Miguel A Rico-Ramirez <https://research-information.bris.ac.uk/en/persons/miguel-a-rico-ramirez>`_
